bibl.title: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to Philip Showalter Hench, July 16, 1940

div1.p: Hutchison contacts Barker, an associate of Jesse Lazear.

div1.head: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to Philip Showalter Hench, July 16, 1940

opener.dateline:
THE PRESIDENT'S OFFICE
WASHINGTON AND JEFFERSON COLLEGE
WASHINGTON, PENNSYLVANIA
July 16, 1940

div1.p:
I have just heard that a distinguished man,
Doctor Barker of Baltimore, was an intimate associate
of Doctor Lazear. I have written him a letter the copy
of which is enclosed herewith. I thought you might be
interested in this relationship and I will let you
know what I find out.

Everything is going well and we are hoping to
get away to New England about the first of August. Why
dont you and Mary come up there for a vacation! The
address is Camp Diamond, Colebrook, New Hampshire.
Give our love to Mary and the children.
div1.closer:
Fraternally yours, Hutch Doctor Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
